glossary.title: Technical Glossary
glossary.description: AI-Native Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Textbook

index.title: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics
index.description: From Digital Intelligence to Embodied Autonomous Systems

introduction.title: Book Introduction
introduction.description: Overview and positioning of the AI-Native Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics textbook

part-1/PART_1_overview.title: PART 1 - Foundations of Physical AI
part-1/PART_1_overview.description: Core concepts, principles, and systems that form the foundation for AI-driven physical systems

part-1/physical_ai_fundamentals.title: Chapter 1 - Physical AI Fundamentals
part-1/physical_ai_fundamentals.description: Definition, scope, and positioning of Physical AI within the broader AI and robotics landscape. Explores embodied cognition and the fundamental differences from traditional software AI.

part-1/robotics_systems.title: Chapter 2 - Robotics Systems & Embodied Intelligence
part-1/robotics_systems.description: Hardware fundamentals, system architecture, control loops, and the design principles underlying modern robotics systems. Covers sensors, actuators, kinematics, and integrated system design.

part-1/sim_to_reality.title: Chapter 3 - From Simulation to Reality (Sim2Real)
part-1/sim_to_reality.description: The digital twin concept, the reality gap problem, domain randomization, and practical techniques for transferring trained policies and models from simulation to physical robots. Covers economic and engineering trade-offs.

part-2/agent_ros_communication.title: Chapter 7 - Agent-to-ROS Communication Patterns
part-2/agent_ros_communication.description: Integration of AI agents (learned policies, planners, decision systems) with ROS 2 communication layer, addressing latency, failure modes, and real-time constraints.

part-2/nodes_topics_services_actions.title: Chapter 5 - Nodes, Topics, Services, and Actions
part-2/nodes_topics_services_actions.description: Deep dive into ROS 2's core communication abstractions, practical patterns, design decisions, and failure modes for distributed robotics systems.

part-2/PART_2_overview.title: PART 2 - ROS 2 - The Robotic Nervous System
part-2/PART_2_overview.description: Overview of Part 2, covering ROS 2 architecture, node communication patterns, Python development, agent integration, and robot description languages.

part-2/python_ros2_development.title: Chapter 6 - Python-Based ROS 2 Development with rclpy
part-2/python_ros2_development.description: Practical guide to writing production-quality ROS 2 nodes in Python using rclpy, including initialization, spin loops, threading models, parameters, and safe shutdown.

part-2/ros2_architecture.title: Chapter 4 - ROS 2 Architecture and Middleware
part-2/ros2_architecture.description: Comprehensive overview of ROS 2 architecture, middleware, publish/subscribe patterns, services, actions, QoS, and design principles for distributed robotics systems.

part-2/urdf_robot_description.title: Chapter 8 - URDF and Robot Description for Humanoids
part-2/urdf_robot_description.description: Complete guide to describing robot kinematics, dynamics, and geometry using URDF, with focus on humanoid robots and ROS 2 integration.

part-4/PART_4_overview.title: PART 4 Overview
part-4/PART_4_overview.description: NVIDIA Isaac - The AI Robot Brain - Coming Soon

part-7/PART_7_overview.title: PART 7 Overview
part-7/PART_7_overview.description: Capstone - Autonomous Humanoid System - Coming Soon
